Comment: The Attorney General sets the direction of the Department but doesn't do the work. The FBI Director is closer to the work and changing FBI Directors would interrupt ongoing cases in a way disruptive to the interests of justice. And the Attorney General is a member of the Cabinet. He doesn't get to stay unless the new President wants him to (generally not when the White House changes parties.)
